1.text: And I, brethren, was not able to speak to you as spiritual, but as carnal, as babes in Christ.

2.text: I have given you milk to drink, and not food; for ye were not able, but neither now are ye yet able.

3.text: For yet are ye carnal: for wherefore envy in you, and strife, and divisions, are ye not carnal, and walk according to man?

4.text: For when a certain one should say, I truly am of Paul; and another, I of Apollos; are ye not carnal?

5.text: Who then is Paul, and who Apollos, but servants by whom ye believed, and to each as the Lord gave?

6.text: I have planted, Apollos watered; but God increased.

7.text: So that neither he planting is anything, neither he watering; but God increasing.

8.text: And he planting and he watering are one: and each shall receive his own reward according to his own labor.

9.text: For we are workers together with God: the agriculture of God, ye are the building of God.

10.text: According to the grace of God given to me, as a wise chief-architect, I have laid the foundation, and another builds upon. And let each see how he builds upon.

11.text: For none is able to lay another foundation above that laid, which is Jesus the Christ.

12.text: And if any one build upon this foundation gold, silver, precious stones, wood, grass, stalks;

13.text: The work of each shall be manifested: for the day shall manifest, for in fire it is revealed; and the work of each, what sort it is, the fire shall prove.

14.text: If the work of any shall remain which he built upon, he shall receive a reward.

15.text: If the work of any one shall be burned, he shall be caused damage: and he shall be saved; and so as by fire.

16.text: Know ye not that ye are the temple of God, and the spirit of God dwells in you?

17.text: If any one destroy the temple of God, him will God destroy; for the temple of God is holy, which ye are.

18.text: Let none completely deceive himself. If any think to be wise in this life, let him be foolish, that he may he wise.

19.text: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it has been written, He seizing the wise in their deceptions.

20.text: And again, The Lord knows the reasonings of the wise, that they are vain.

21.text: Therefore let none boast in men. For all things are yours;

22.text: Whether Paul, or Apollos, or Cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or about to be; all are yours;

23.text: And ye of Christ; and Christ of God.
